newsitem.title: POLAND: BANK SLASKI RATED LONG-TERM ACCUMULATE.
newsitem.headline: BANK SLASKI RATED LONG-TERM ACCUMULATE.

text.p: Merrill Lynch in London rated Polish Bank Slaski SA as long-term accumulate saying the bank was attractively valued after recent falls.

"After losing 12.7 percent of its value since the end of 1996, Slaski in our view is now attractively valued for investors with a time horizon beyond one year," Merrill Lynch said in a report dated May 15.
The report was issued when Slaski traded at 255 zlotys, the same price as Friday's close.
Merrill Lynch maintained its earlier neutral recommendation for intermediate-term ivestors, saying privatisations of large banks in 1997 and 1998 were a negative factor.
Merrill said Bank Slaski net income was likely to fall to 259 million zlotys this year, but rise to 316 million in 1998, against 289 million last year.
It said its price earnings ratio was seen at 9.1 in 1997, 7.5 next year after 8.2 in 1996.
